questDatabase.name: Your first night
questDatabase.description: You first task will be to find food, and a shelter for the night. The nights will be cruelsome, as this pack has HardcoreDarkness. It probably would be a good idea to collect some food now...

questDatabase.name: Where is the flint?
questDatabase.description: As you might have noticed, while collecting gravel, no flint dropped for you. Well, there is an ap.. recipe for that. Look up flint in NEI and craft some!

questDatabase.name: Sticks 'n Stones
questDatabase.description: This book as a built-in reading light, lucky you! Most probably you will read this text while you are waiting for the night to be over. Once it is, go out and collect some gravel and wood. Keep in mind that you need food, so look for Pam's Harvestcraft gardens. (And save some of the vegetables for seeds!)

questDatabase.name: Storage for days
questDatabase.description: Now that you've unlocked 3x3 crafting, it's about time to make some storage for your goods. Take some of your wood, and craft a chest. You will need 4 wood, 4 planks and 1 flint

questDatabase.name: Crafting time
questDatabase.description: It's time to get yourself a 3x3 crafting area. Grab some flint and some wood, and build one!

questDatabase.name: Tools
questDatabase.description: Now that you've got a shelter, crafting table and a place to store your items, you should make some tools. (Except you'd like to continue punching trees with your bare hand...)

questDatabase.name: You reap...
questDatabase.description: You won't always get food rewards from this book, so it might be a good idea to take care of that problem. As you've created a hoe already, go and find some water nearby and make a field. Let's trade some sticks for a carrot, so you can start your farm.

questDatabase.name: ...what you sow
questDatabase.description: If you, by chance, did read the previous quest and planted the carrot I gave you, then you're fine. Meanwhile, you should turn some more fruits and vegetables into seeds, and increase your farm to get a steady supply of food

questDatabase.name: Get that stone
questDatabase.description: Look at you, with your shiny flint pickaxe! Time to mine some cobblestone. Yay! (And maybe you can improve this dirt-hut to...)

questDatabase.name: Fire, fire, Grandpa!
questDatabase.description: Time to burn some stuff, isn't it? You can't make charcoal in it, but you sure will find some usage for it soon

questDatabase.name: Rest in pieces
questDatabase.description: It's GLOPPing time! Go kill some pigs to gather meat. (And yes, they will drop cooked porkchop. Now if that isn't useful..)

questDatabase.name: Sharpness: Over.. 5..
questDatabase.description: It's about time to craft some more usefull stuff: A sword!

questDatabase.name: Fluffy and red
questDatabase.description: Epic quest: Kill some sheep! (And try to find some wool, for a bed, obviously)

questDatabase.name: SO..TIRED..MUST..SLEEP..
questDatabase.description: Sleepy time. And: The end of Tier 0. Congratulations, you build yourself your first hideout, and you should have a steady supply of food by now. See you again in Tier 1!

questDatabase.name: What is that..?
questDatabase.description: You've seen a lot of trees, but there are a few that really look special. You are sure that these trees are more than just wood to build your home or get charcoal

questDatabase.name: Read, set, go!
questDatabase.description: You probably should have a home by now. A steady supply of food is a fundamental requirement all the time. Take this journal to keep track of the things you've eaten, while you proceed. You will have to travel far in this Tier, better be prepared!

questDatabase.name: Better Tank...... Iron Tank
questDatabase.description:
Store more than 16 Buckets of Fluids in one tank? Sure make some iron Tank or upgrade the Buildcraft Tank.
Diamond Tanks carry up to 64 Buckets and Obsidian ones are blast proof.

questDatabase.name: The Gathering: Sand
questDatabase.description: In a strange vision you saw a big structure which would allow you to make charcoal. Finally some torches! According to your calculations, you would need a lot of sand for that

questDatabase.name: Basic processing
questDatabase.description: Most things are unavailable at the moment, so lets begin with somethign simple. Take some of your cobblestone and smelt it into regular stone. And because this modpack is evil, you'll need to use wood for that. How much fun is that!

questDatabase.name: Macerator v0.1 Alpha
questDatabase.description: This fancy little device works (almost..) like a macerator. Some people say it's even better, since it does not require power, yay! You only need to craft one for this quest, but you probably should do some more if you can...

questDatabase.name: The Gathering: Gravel
questDatabase.description: While collecting resources, your tools will loose durability. You think it would be a good idea to collect more gravel in order to provide yourself with flint for more tools

questDatabase.name: The Gathering: Clay
questDatabase.description: While beeing bored, you thought that it might be a good idea to kill your time with pottery. You should go and find some clay

questDatabase.name: Finite Water..?
questDatabase.description: Finite Water is a problem, that's for sure. But last night, you had an idea. If you can drink cacti, you should also be able to use it for most recipes that require water. How cool is that? So what about another trade; 10 Wood for.. 3 Cacti so you can setup a farm. Deal?

questDatabase.name: Something to carry liquids
questDatabase.description: You tried to move water with you bare hands, which didn't work at all. Luckily, you remember a recipe how to make a bucket with clay

questDatabase.name: Getting coal
questDatabase.description: It's time to get yourself some charcoal. For that, we're going to build a coke oven. Good that you just collected a lot of resources!

questDatabase.name: Another brick in the wall
questDatabase.description: Your vision becomes more clear, you'll need bricks for your first multiblock structure. You think that 104 Bricks will be enough. However, the bricks you'll need are somewhat special. Pay attention to craft the correct ones!

questDatabase.name: Forming press v0.1
questDatabase.description: As you might have noticed, you cannot turn clay into bricks as usual. Well, to be fair, it wasn't a good recipe anyways. You'll probably end up with something bread-shaped. So in order to make bricks, you need a form. Get yourself a knife and a blank pattern, and cut a brick sized piece out. As easy as that

questDatabase.name: Finally, some power
questDatabase.description: Now that you've unlocked your coke oven, you should start producing charcoal. The more, the better. Don't worry about the creosote oil; I have another deal for you...

questDatabase.name: Copper sky
questDatabase.description: With your new acquired fuel source, you are now ready to process more advanced materials than stone or clay; Iron or copper, for example. Just in care you don't know, they spawn in rather large veins. Use the following quests to search and locate the most important veins you'll need

questDatabase.name: Another fuel source
questDatabase.description: Lignite and regular coal is the fuel source you'll definitely need; as the latter can be turned into coke, which is a superior material to smelt your first large batch of Ore

questDatabase.name: Copper
questDatabase.description: Can be found either between y 10 and 40 as "Malachite Ore", or between 5 and 60 as "Copper Ore" or "Chalcopyrite". Most times you'll find it together with forms of Iron, such as Yellow/Brown Limonite

questDatabase.name: Tin
questDatabase.description: Found mostly in Mountains, between y 60 and 220. Also there veins are a source of Cassiterite

questDatabase.name: Bookparts
questDatabase.description: After you've found a way to pickup and move around water, you had another brilliant idea: Paper! Usually made with Sugarcane, which doesn't work anymore (And is pretty weird anyways..). However, you will need a lot of wood to craft wood pulp, so better grab your Axe and go choppin' some trees

questDatabase.name: Tinker-time
questDatabase.description: While using your flint-tools is fun in terms of burning pigs and cows, they are not pretty good, and can't be repaired. You had an idea how to craft tools that could be repaired and upgraded, but for that you definitely need some more advanced crafting tables

questDatabase.name: Aluminini...um...?
questDatabase.description: Whatever it is spelled, you will need it. Mostly found on the surface. Try to search in rivers (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: Making bronze
questDatabase.description: Now that you've found copper and tin, you should make yourself some bronze. Use your macer.. mortar to grind up some copper and tin, and mix them together!

questDatabase.name: Important tools
questDatabase.description: In order to craft even the basic machines, you'll need new tools. Most of them can be replaced by machines later, but for now, you should make yourself familar with each of their recipes, as you will need a lot of these tools starting today

questDatabase.name: Getting iron
questDatabase.description: With your new bronze tools, you are able to mine another "primal" ore: Iron. There are other iron compounds you can mine earlier, like pyrite. But iron itself, can only be mined with a bronze tool

questDatabase.name: Making better tools
questDatabase.description: With Aluminum and Copper, you can create a pretty durable material, which can be used to cast better (And repairable!) tools. These can be used to mine some more advanced ores like Iron

questDatabase.name: Better storage
questDatabase.description: As crafting chests is a good idea for your basic items and goods, it is not for the vast amount of ores. You should build yourself some barrels in order to keep things organized

questDatabase.name: You shall proceed
questDatabase.description: As you've gathered and crafted all materials and tools you need for your basic steam machinery, you may now proceed to the next tier. Keep in mind that you'll need mountains of resources in order to craft even the simplest things, so you probably should stock up on all ores in this tier. But that's up to you

questDatabase.name: Don't burn your fingers!
questDatabase.description: You have decided its time to make some tasty pizza, but your fingers got burned badly. Reading an ancient cookbook you discover a magical item that would allow you to carry anything hot, even lava in a bucket

questDatabase.name: Cow Tripper
questDatabase.description: Before you kill some Pigs and Sheep's to complete previous Quests. Now it's time to kill some Cows and hopefully get some Leather. If you are lucky and get some Cow Trophy you never need to kill any Cow in the future.

questDatabase.name: Cotton, cotton and more cotten
questDatabase.description: You find out that Cotton is very useful. You can make wool out of it (how you can do this this very magical) Strings can made out of Cotton too and some other useful items. Make some small Cotton plantation to get more of this useful stuff.

questDatabase.name: Welcome to Tier 1
questDatabase.description: Welcome and well done so far! This tier is all about your first machines, getting twice the amount of ingots from your ores and making bronze ingots more efficient than you did before

questDatabase.name: Multiblock Tanks..... Railcraft Tanks
questDatabase.description: 576 Buckets of Fluids...... Enough to store all the Creosote in i made before. If this isn't enough i can make this Tank bigger.  The smallest Tank are 3x4 the biggest 9x8 Blocks.

questDatabase.name: More advanced alloys
questDatabase.description: Your smeltery does a great job in mixing metals to alloys, but it's not very efficient, and limited in its complexity. You need something new, so why not put your steam to some use?

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: High speed alloys
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. Like most machines, there is a more advanced version of the alloy smelter. Keep in mind that this machine used a lot of steam, so you better get some more boilers first

questDatabase.name: A very important alloy
questDatabase.description: Basically the most important alloy (until you reach a higher tier) is without questioning, red alloy. Fortunately, you have an alloy smelter, so better grab some redstone and get yourself a handful of that.

questDatabase.name: The hell is that?
questDatabase.description: In order to get more machines, you'll need pistons. But not those amateurishly ones, you need special ones, and I shall guide you how to make those

questDatabase.name: Macerator v1.0!
questDatabase.description: Finally you are able to get a device, that will replace your mortar. However, the "no-durability" feature of this device comes with a cost: You need 2 diamonds for the grinding heads

questDatabase.name: Extracting stuff
questDatabase.description: As you'll need rubber sheets later on in order to wrap wires into cables, you should get yourself a steam extractor. You can also use this machine to get more dyes from flowers, or process different fruits into juice

questDatabase.name: A clear view
questDatabase.description: Still living in your dirt/cobblestone bunker? What about some windows? Put some sand in your smeltery, and pour it into a casting basin to make clear glass. In order to use it for recipes, you have to macerate it up and smelt it in any furnace

questDatabase.name: Hammer time v2
questDatabase.description: Using 6 ingots to craft a hammer seems to be pretty wasteful, as these tools use up durability. How nice would it be to have machine that does the same but without having durability? Guess what, there is one! And you should totally get one

questDatabase.name: Compressing stuff
questDatabase.description: This rather simple device does a very important job: Compressing things. As you are not able to get blocks just by pressing 9 ingots with your bare hands, it is also usefull to do various additional tasks, for example making firm tofu

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Better compressor
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam compressor. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Forge hammer
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam forge hammer. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Extractor
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam extractor. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. You most probably want to craft this, as the normal extractor does also extract your nerves...

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Better macerator
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam macerator. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast.

questDatabase.name: Steam alternatives
questDatabase.description: There is more than one way to get steam for your machines. This completely optional quests shall show you some ways to get steam for your steam age

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Coal boiler
questDatabase.description: This is basically just an upgrade to your current coal boiler, however it produces more than twice as much steam. Something you should consider building if you're planning to get some of the machines upgrades

questDatabase.name: Another use for lava
questDatabase.description: With the more durable steel casings, you can now even use lava to make steam

questDatabase.name: The power of the sun
questDatabase.description: The sun has quite a bit of power, so why not use it to produce steam?

questDatabase.name: Using steam for cook things
questDatabase.description: A rather slow process, but it's more efficient than using a regular furnace

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Better furnace
questDatabase.description: This quest is optional. An updated version of the steam furnace. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast.

questDatabase.name: Blast-off
questDatabase.description: It's about time to make some steel. Look in the Multiblock-QuestSet and build a bronze blast furnace. Return when you made at least 8 steel ingots

questDatabase.name: Time for some logic
questDatabase.description: Good news is: You are now able to advance to the next tier! Bad news is: You still have to craft a lot of things before you can begin. But fear not mortal, I shall guide you!

questDatabase.name: Wired!
questDatabase.description: One of the very basic materials where you should memorize how to craft them are wires and cables. Basically you just cut a plate into a wire with your wire cutter. Not very efficient, but there will be a better way later

questDatabase.name: Your first logic circuit
questDatabase.description: Where steam machines are kinda stupid and just do one thing again and again, as you advance into electrical age, you've decided that you want the machines to have more features, like auto-output in order to create some automation. For that, you need logic circuits

questDatabase.name: Wire-Wrap
questDatabase.description: Placing wires without insulation seems to be a bad idea. Now that you have an extractor to extract rubber pulp out of sticky resin, you should process this pulp into sheets

questDatabase.name: Steam-a-licious!
questDatabase.description: You almost made it. One last crafting step is required in order to advance to Tier 2. Keep going!

questDatabase.name: Basic crafting: Motors
questDatabase.description: Motors are little devices that can turn electical power into rotational energy. Very usefull for all kind of machines, and not that difficult to craft. The pattern is always the same, only the materials change with a higher tier

questDatabase.name: Basic crafting: Rotors
questDatabase.description: Rotors are also always crafted in an identical pattern. A bit annoying to craft at the moment, but you don't need a lot of them anyways

questDatabase.name: Basic crafting: Casings
questDatabase.description: All machines need a hull to keep their private parts hidden and together. Good news is: They are crafted in the same way for every tier. Only the materials do change

questDatabase.name: You are not prepared
questDatabase.description: It's time for something really big: A smeltery! It's a lot to craft, so better gather some resources...

questDatabase.name: The water problem
questDatabase.description: Finite water is a problem. But fear not, there are solutions! I shall guide you to get a steady supply of water

questDatabase.name: Time to get some steel
questDatabase.description: You need steel? Fine. Let's get busy...

questDatabase.name: EBF-Time
questDatabase.description: In order to get alumin(i)um, you need an electrical blast furnace. It's another very important step towards victory, so let's get started

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #1: More heat
questDatabase.description: Better materials need higher temperatures. You can just exchange the old coils with the new ones. You can even recycle the old coils, how fancy is that!

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #2: Higher tier
questDatabase.description: To reach the 3600k heat capacity of your EBF, so you can process high-tier materials like Tungsten, you need Nichrome heating coils

questDatabase.name: Compress all the things
questDatabase.description: Martin's favourite machine. Compress ALL the things! With explosives, of course.

questDatabase.name: In the universe ...
questDatabase.description: ...there's only one absolute... everything freezes! Now it's somewhat expensive to launch into space just to cool down a few ingots, so why not build a machine which can simulate the cold environment?

questDatabase.name: An unexpected Bonus
questDatabase.description: Because we're nice Developers, we decided to add a little bonus if you happen to compress charcoal. Not only enables it to process more than 16 steel at a time, it also yields 10x the burn time per block instead of 9x. So one charcoal for free. This bonus only occurs on the first compression step. (But for fanciness, you should definitely get a Quintuple one!)

questDatabase.name: Highspeed Charcoal
questDatabase.description: Sure, those Coke-Ovens are nice, but there aren't even remotely fast enough to keep up with a large steam boiler. Luckily , there is an upgrade available! The produced creosote oil is consumed instead of returned; But it will speed up the process dramatically. Who needs that nasty yellowish stuff anyways...

questDatabase.name: Where i can put all the Liquids in
questDatabase.description: With your rand New Alloy Smelter you are able to combine two materials. What happened if you mixing some Obsidian Dust and Glass? Obsidian Glass great. Your Fist Tank you can made would be a Buildcraft Tank. This Tank carry up to 16 Buckets of each Fluid. It is possible to upgrade those tanks up to 64 Bucket Tanks.

questDatabase.name: Smelt all the things...
questDatabase.description: ...at once! Uses power to smelt up to 18 items in one step. Can't go any faster! (Well, maybe with those fancy new LuV+ Tier machines in this pack...)

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #3: Highest Tier
questDatabase.description: To process Draconium and Neutronium you need more than 3600K. Upgrade your EBF to 9000K.

questDatabase.name: Steel Multiblock Tanks
questDatabase.description: Want to double the amount of Liquid a Tank can hold. Sure make a Steel Tank. All sizes allowed from 3x4 to 9x8 Blocks.

questDatabase.name: Welcome to Tier 2
questDatabase.description: Why, hello there! Seems you've made it into electrical age. But behold, do not throw your steam machines away, you'll probably want to use them until you reach Tier 3

questDatabase.name: Tier 3
questDatabase.description: In Tier 3, you will be able to craft your first actually "useful" machines. Basic ones do the job, but with MV, a lot more recipes unlock. Your goal here is to reach a stable ore-processing for the vast amounts of materials you'll need for Tier 4. You also should focus on power production if you haven't already.

questDatabase.name: Damn you, wirecutter!
questDatabase.description: Enough is enough. No more wasting of gazillions of ingots just for a couple of wires. Now that you have power, you should go for a wiremill!

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #1
questDatabase.description: The first item you'll need a lot of. If you want to pull items out of Chests or Barrels you need one.

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #3
questDatabase.description: The third item you'll need a lot of, and is also a pain to craft. Probably, the most painfull item ever...

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #2
questDatabase.description: The second item you'll need a lot of. When you want to get the Fluid out of the Thanks you need one.

questDatabase.name: Electric macerator
questDatabase.description: It is highly recommended to get one of these, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to macerate something is a lot better when using EU here

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #4
questDatabase.description: A piston, but more .. "Electrical". The 4th item you gonna craft a lot in the future

questDatabase.name: Saving redstone
questDatabase.description: Tired of using 4 redstone for one magnetic rod? Well, good news for you! The polarizer doesn't need redstone, just a little bit of power. You don't need to attach this machine to a permanent power source, it runs fine on batteries

questDatabase.name: Avengers, assemble!
questDatabase.description: An absolute must have for fans of the movie. Oh, and to make all the things, of course.

questDatabase.name: No more filing
questDatabase.description: Why wasting a full ingot to make a rod, that needs a tool which looses durability and takes even more ingots? With just this little device, all your rod-needs shall be fulfilled (for now)

questDatabase.name: Bzzz
questDatabase.description: Optional machine. Like the forming press, you don't really *need* it in the 32 EU age. Not mandatory to proceed

questDatabase.name: Press all the things
questDatabase.description: An optional machine, if you want to make circuits more efficient. Not mandatory in 32 EU age, so if you're short on steel, you can skip this device and build the next tier then

questDatabase.name: Electric forge hammer
questDatabase.description: Not really required, but it is a lot faster than the steam one. And it can be automated. There are no recipes that require more than steam level to hammer something

questDatabase.name: Cutting things apart
questDatabase.description: An absolutely mandatory machine to have. It will cut rods into bolts, plates into casings, and that with the highest possible efficiency. Totally worth it!

questDatabase.name: Get ready for Tier 3
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed forward, you need to get Aluminium. A lot of. But for now, one is enough to unlock this quest. Probably the best source for Aluminium is clay, but you need a MV machine for that. So you need to find an alternative until you have enough dusts for your first machine

questDatabase.name: Your magic progression
questDatabase.description: Now that you are able to produce Aluminium, you may dig into magic. If you haven't unlocked basic thaumaturgy, try to find a silverwood and a greatwood sapling

questDatabase.name: The missing one
questDatabase.description: <basdxz> But ffs, add a plate bender to the LV tier book

questDatabase.name: Your first automation
questDatabase.description: Well, probably not the first, but definitely something big! First you need a cart assembler

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Power
questDatabase.description: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered by solar and lava; But for now you have to use a simple coal engine

questDatabase.name: Automated (un-)loading
questDatabase.description: You can fill and empty your cart manually, but it's a lot more convenient to automate that; Isn't it?

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Farming
questDatabase.description: Unfortunately, the basic farmer can't farm anything besides wheat; But it's not expensive at all, and probably the cheapest solution to give your automated food production a boost

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Storage
questDatabase.description: A basic cart can't hold any items, so you need to attach chests to it

questDatabase.name: A simple cart
questDatabase.description: In order to create or customize your cart you need a hull to attach your desired updates to. Wood can be used for really simple item transfer, but to farm wheat or wood, you need at least an iron one

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Wood cutter
questDatabase.description: The basic wood cutter will break after a while, but you never have to replace it. It can be simply repaired with Diamonds

questDatabase.name: Basic transport pipe
questDatabase.description: These pipes are rather simple and won't do anything on their own; But in combination with Transfer Nodes, you'll soon find out how great they are. Also, given the correct updates, they even surpass most other transfer systems

questDatabase.name: Basic transport: Items
questDatabase.description: In order to transfer items, you need so called "nodes". There are some for pushing items into a pipe system, and later you'll have access to nodes that are able to pull items from attached inventories

questDatabase.name: Basic transport: Fluids
questDatabase.description: Just like item nodes, liquid nodes transfer.. liquids. But probably the best thing: They can all utilize the same transfer pipe!

questDatabase.name: Accelerated plant growth
questDatabase.description: Plants grow very slowly, you might've discovered that by now. So why not do something against that? A watering can will come in handy very soon

questDatabase.name: Gotta catch 'em all
questDatabase.description: Sure, you can use wheat/potatoes/carrots to make animals follow you back to your base, but that can be tedious. A golden lasso is a proper solution for that

questDatabase.name: Basic monster protection
questDatabase.description: Spawning monsters in or near your base can be annoying. Especially if you happen to get a silverfish creeper. Luckily, there is a way to prevent them to spawn at all

questDatabase.name: A quite different storage
questDatabase.description: Normal chests can fill up rather quickly if you happen to collect mob drops like swords and / or armor. By using a cabinet, you can store up to 270 items of the same type

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 1
questDatabase.description: One needs proper protection for his home. So why not get some turrets for safety? At the moment, 2 Turrets are available; "Potato" and "disposable item". I assume you can guess what they do and how they work...

questDatabase.name: Passive defense
questDatabase.description: A more "passive" approach to base defense are walls and fences. But seriously, where is the fun?

questDatabase.name: Turret base
questDatabase.description: Turrets must be placed on top of a turret base. Only the player who initially played the base can access and configure the turret; So don't worry about people taking your ammunition

questDatabase.name: Who needs that dirt anyways
questDatabase.description: You probably have a ton of items floating around in your base; So why not use it to kill enemies?

questDatabase.name: Don't play with food!
questDatabase.description: Use it to kill Zombies instead. Does only little damage, but hey, who cares?

questDatabase.name: Upgrades
questDatabase.description: Your turrets probably need more space to hold more ammunition, so why not get an upgrade for that?

questDatabase.name: Electrolyzing all the things
questDatabase.description: You collecting a lot of Dusts since you start with macerating, washing and centrifuge Ores. Until now you cant seperating it at all. Now its time to get all the pure and valualeMaterials out of the DustsYou collecting a lot of Dusts since you start with macerating, washing and centrifuge Ores. Until now you can't separating it at all. Now it's time to get all the pure and valuable Materials out of the Dusts.

questDatabase.name: Basic item storage
questDatabase.description: Having tons of chests everywhere can get quite annoying after a while. Getting an AE System is not an option either, as you don't have access to the required materials yet. But there is an early solution for that problem

questDatabase.name: Ender not-so-IO
questDatabase.description: You've probably used EnderIO before. It's quite useful for a lot of things. But a lot of stuff has changed here, so let's start from scratch

questDatabase.name: Machine chassis
questDatabase.description: All EnderIO machines still require the basic chassis, and it's almost the same recipe as before; Except that you need plates instead of ingots. But that shouldn't be a problem at all...

questDatabase.name: Portable tanks
questDatabase.description: Until now, you where required to use buildcraft tanks to carry liquids around; Which can be a pain to do. These little tanks are able to push and pull liquids by themselfs, as they have a buildin pump which is powered by some magic energy source. How convenient.

questDatabase.name: Simple RF-Power: Solid
questDatabase.description: By simply burning coal as fuel, this machine produces RF power. But a lot, but enough for a basic machine setup

questDatabase.name: Simple RF-Power: Liquids
questDatabase.description: This generator requires both water as coolant, and a burnable liquid; Such as fuel. The amount of power it produces depends on the liquid used

questDatabase.name: The power of endermen
questDatabase.description: Elevators are nice, but they are limited to vertical teleportation, and their range also is somewhat limited. TravelAnchors do not have that limitation; You can teleport from one Anchor to any other within range; You can name them and even set them to private.

questDatabase.name: Conduits
questDatabase.description: Probably the most awesome way to transport just anything in multiple different ways. Get some of each type

questDatabase.name: Yet another wrench
questDatabase.description: The Yeta Wrench is more than just a regular wrench; While holding it, you are able to switch between available conduits, eventually allowing you remove one specific conduit type from a bundle of many. Ctrl-Mousewheel will switch modes; Also Shift-Leftclick allows you to open the configuration interface even if you don't have access to that side of the conduit

questDatabase.name: Improving conduits
questDatabase.description: Conduits on their own are pretty awesome, but you can do better. By using filters and speed upgrades, you gain even more control over what and how fast they work

questDatabase.name: Making things pretty
questDatabase.description: While conduits on their own are already awesome, you can also hide them if you want. There are 2 types of facades, basic and hardened. While basic ones are simple and easy, the reinforced ones are able to withstand explosions and mining with tools. You have to use your Yeta Wrench to remove it

questDatabase.name: Come to the dark side...
questDatabase.description: ...we have cookies

questDatabase.name: Luke, i'm your father
questDatabase.description: With that dark steel you got, you may now craft yourself a new set of armor. While pretty basic first, it can be upgraded later to unlock powerful features

questDatabase.name: Dark steel tools
questDatabase.description: There are also tools made of dark steel. Each of them can receive upgrades; Hold shift to get the tooltip which will explain what you need in order to upgrade them.

questDatabase.name: Basic upgrades
questDatabase.description: In order to upgrade your armor and tools, you need 10 Levels each, but also 8 Vibrant crystals

questDatabase.name: Brewing liquids
questDatabase.description: This machine is not only capable of brewing more powerful burnable liquids, it can also be used to brew nutrient distillation, which might have a further usage soon

questDatabase.name: Smelting alloys
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Automated crafting
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Ore processing
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Torture device
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Not for rockets...
questDatabase.description: It claims to be rocket fuel, but it isn't. However, it does generate quite a bit of power. Use your "Vat" to make some. Will generate 160 RF/t when used in a combustion generator

questDatabase.name: Tasty...
questDatabase.description: Yeah, that is... Well.. You are sure it will have an usage for something.. some day...

questDatabase.name: Firewater
questDatabase.description: Not exaclty what you think it is; It's better to not consume that liquid. When used in the combustion generator, it will produce 80RF/t

questDatabase.name: Hootch
questDatabase.description: The lowest tier of renewable, burnable fluid. Generates 60 RF/t, but can be automated for "green" infinite power

questDatabase.name: Automated Mob-Farming
questDatabase.description: Of course... A zombie loves that ... disgusting liquid. While using a small amount per hit, he will attack everything that is within his range. That also includes players, so be careful. Rumors are, that there might be a weapon that will never break when used in this "machine"...

questDatabase.name: And it will never break
questDatabase.description: By using an etheric sword, your KillerJoe will run.. forever. Proper enchantments are a requirement for be efficient, but that shouldn't be a problem

questDatabase.name: Simple item transfer
questDatabase.description: Translocators can only transfer items over a distance of 1 block. But they're quite cheap, and a good solution to build compact machines

questDatabase.name: Simple fluid transfer
questDatabase.description: Just like the item translocators, the fluid ones transfer.. fluids. Same restrictions apply; 1 Block distance

questDatabase.name: Harder, stronger, faster
questDatabase.description: No, actually not faster. But more durable than Tier1.

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 2
questDatabase.description: Slightly better protection; And now with a real gun. No more food wasting

questDatabase.name: Tier 2 turret base
questDatabase.description: Nothing to see here. Proceed

questDatabase.name: Sometimes, a bullet will do
questDatabase.description: They hit hard. You have been warned

questDatabase.name: Burn them. Burn them all!
questDatabase.description: Hmmm, crispy bacon. What would happen if you enable neutral mobs as target..?

questDatabase.name: Tier 4
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Tier 3
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Moon
questDatabase.description: HV is the age where you should focus on reaching the moon, as soon as possible. You need titanium in large quantities

questDatabase.name: I see everything
questDatabase.description: The inventory panel is an alternative to your (hopefully?) existing ProjectRed storage system. Just like project red, you have to connect every chest/barrel with an item conduit. In addition to that, you also have to install a "remote awareness" upgrade into every (!) conduit you want the panel to see

questDatabase.name: Tasty...
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Soul eater
questDatabase.description: Wouldn't it be great to actually make use of the intelligence or abilities a certain creature has? For example; The ender-teleportation? Or use the brain capacity of a zombie for simple logic? (He doesn't use it anyways...) With this machine, you are able to bind a captured soul to an item, which can then be used in machines to improve their functionality

questDatabase.name: A new alloy
questDatabase.description: There are some... "Darker" uses for machines. Stuff that might be considered "Magic". Anyways, for that you need a new alloy; Soularium

questDatabase.name: Experience-Storage
questDatabase.description: Dying is painful, isn't it? As your precious experience is lost. But fear not, there is a solution! By using an experience obelisk, you are now able to store all your experience in a safe location

questDatabase.name: A soul vessel
questDatabase.description: For your new machine, you need something to actually capture souls from monsters. The soul vials are reusable vessels; Just right-click any living entity to steal its soul.

questDatabase.name: The creation of life
questDatabase.description: By utilizing large amounts of energy, you're able to re-activate those broken spawners you may have found in the past. If you haven't, you should get one now

questDatabase.name: Specific enchantments
questDatabase.description: Enchanting books is, just as it is for items, random. And that is annoying if you need a specific enchantment on your tool or armor. Now there is a way to actually select enchantments, for a price, obviously.

questDatabase.name: Almost like steel
questDatabase.description: Next-gen protection against nasty Zombies, creepers and other "stuff"

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 3
questDatabase.description: Now we're talking; Grenades! Big booms.

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 base
questDatabase.description: More storage, more power, and a lot more slots for possible upgrades

questDatabase.name: This is relative useful
questDatabase.description: For... some things... mabye... At least it is fun to watch

questDatabase.name: Fire in the hole
questDatabase.description: Ah, there is nothing like an explosion and the certitude that your enemies have been blasted to pieces

questDatabase.name: Tier 5
questDatabase.description: The main goal here is to get a Tier 2 rocket, and reach mars. You also might want to rethink your power setup, as more and more machines will be upgraded. This questset will teach you about a couple of options you have regarding power production.

questDatabase.name: Tier 4
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: It's storage time
questDatabase.description: Now that you've reached HighVoltage age, you might consider starting to work on your AE System. It might be small, and it might be tricky to power it at first, but it's really worth the effort. You should start by collecting all 4 inscriber patterns

questDatabase.name: Find them all
questDatabase.description: There are a lot of asteroids on the surface, but there are more; Underground. In order to find those, you need a compass. This quest is optional

questDatabase.name: Drives
questDatabase.description: Quite different from anything you've seen before. Make sure to check out the Item/Fluid processors!

questDatabase.name: Fluix crystals
questDatabase.description: Not "flux"; Even if the color is the same

questDatabase.name: Autocrafting
questDatabase.description: Crafting can be a pain. So why not automate it?

questDatabase.name: Getting your first circuits
questDatabase.description: Making the circuits is quite different from what you're used to, so it's advised to check NEI for the new recipes. Get 8 of each circuit for now

questDatabase.name: Cables
questDatabase.description: To have access to your AE from your entire base, you'll need cables. A lot of them. For now, the basic ones will do, but eventually, you'll end up using dense cables and P2P Channels

questDatabase.name: Terminals everywhere
questDatabase.description: And a pain to craft, no doubt

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Mars
questDatabase.description: No Description

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Phobos
questDatabase.description: A smaller goal, as the main goal is mars. But you'll find different ores on this planet

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Deimos
questDatabase.description: A smaller goal, as the main goal is mars. But you'll find different ores on this planet

questDatabase.name: HEV Mark III Protective System
questDatabase.description: Some things are dirty, and some things are even dangerous. You'll play with nasty stuff here, so better prepare yourself

questDatabase.name: Appropriate power
questDatabase.description: Whether you used Magic, Steam, Oil or Biogas for power until now, you'll run into problems as you advance to higher tiers. So you need to upgrade your power grid; At least for your blast furnaces. So let's start with something more powerful: A nuclear reactor

questDatabase.name: Tier 2 fuel: Uranium
questDatabase.description: Just "regular" uranium fuel, nothing special about it

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 fuel: MOX
questDatabase.description: Highly reactive, but the most powerful fuel rod you can get. Burns twice as fast as uranium, but produces massive amounts of power. Rumors are, that peaks up to 11k EU/t are possible...

questDatabase.name: Tier 1 fuel: Thorium
questDatabase.description: The weakest of all rods, but very easy to produce, very easy to keep cool and runs twice as long as uranium. A perfect "fire and forget" power source

questDatabase.name: Monitoring your reactor
questDatabase.description: It's important to monitor your reactor (Or just fancy to have a big screen somewhere...) So now that you've gained knowledge about the available fuel rods, you can start to build yourself a power plant. Here is something to help you out

questDatabase.name: Increasing the capacity
questDatabase.description: To unleash the full potential of your reactor, you have to attach 6 reactor chambers to it

questDatabase.name: Move the heat
questDatabase.description: Reactors heat up, well the rods do, so you need to "move the heat away" to somewhere else. You should get one of each, and try to figure out what each individual heat exchanger does, in order to figure out a good setup

questDatabase.name: Venting heat
questDatabase.description: You can't just move the heat around; Eventually you need to get rid of it. Just like the exchangers, there are different types of vents, each of them has a certain usage you'll need to find out

questDatabase.name: Double the fun
questDatabase.description: Need even more power? Why not combine rods? Produces twice the amount of power (and heat, obviously) but only uses up one slot

questDatabase.name: Quit exhaling dusts
questDatabase.description: The QED is used for stuff like EnderQuarry (yay) and advanced mob-protection

questDatabase.name: Advanced mob-protection
questDatabase.description: Like the chandelier, the magnum torch prevents monsters from spawning. However, its range is 128 blocks, so a single one might be enough for your entire base

questDatabase.name: Automated mining
questDatabase.description: The QED enables you to assemble the most convenient devide ever for mining: The EnderQuarry

questDatabase.name: Accelerating things
questDatabase.description: A normal Quarry won't satisfy your needs for MOOORE, so a speed upgrade is required

questDatabase.name: Bundled AE channels
questDatabase.description: P2P tunnels. You need them; A lot of them!

questDatabase.name: Load and Unload the rocket
questDatabase.description: What use has an automated rocket, if you can't load and unload it automated?

questDatabase.name: Cargo rocket; For the fun
questDatabase.description: No need to fly to distant planets anymore on your own to grab mined ores

questDatabase.name: Turning A into B with C
questDatabase.description: Molecular transforming all the things! The most important recipe here is sunnarium

questDatabase.name: Turret base Tier 4
questDatabase.description: Even more range, power and upgrade slots

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 4
questDatabase.description: Parts for powerful turrets

questDatabase.name: Make love, not war
questDatabase.description: For those who don't want to kill things; Just teleport them away. Takes a large amount of power however

questDatabase.name: Why grenades ...
questDatabase.description: ...when you can use rockets? Yes, Rockets! They search and destroy, and go off with a huge boom

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 fence and walls
questDatabase.description: Another upgrade for you walls. One more to go

questDatabase.name: Pulverize the moon
questDatabase.description: Literally. You can grind the rock of most planets, to get a chance for higher tier metal dusts. Does consume quite a bit of power, but can really help you out at times

questDatabase.name: Tier 6
questDatabase.description: IV-Level. You will need Tungstensteel for machines. Supposed Planets to visit: Mars, Phobos, Deimos. You should've learned "How to Gregtech" by now.

questDatabase.name: This is the end.... ?
questDatabase.description: Basically the "end" of the conventional tiered gameplay. However! This is just the start of your journey, as you'll have access to even more powerful and awesome stuff. You have proven yourself worthy, and mastered the challenges up to this Tier; Congratulations!

questDatabase.name: On your way to Tier 7
questDatabase.description: The next Tier is defined as "Asteroids-Dimension" and "8192 EU/t Machines". The machines now reached their full potential, and some asteroids may contain precious ores to improve your powergen

questDatabase.name: "Clean" energy..?
questDatabase.description: Finally, a reliable and powerful source of energy for your base. And why waste your time with a 2k generator? Go for a 8k one! (Hint: It's probably a good idea to wear your hazmat suite before claiming your reward...)

questDatabase.name: Final choice: Void
questDatabase.description: Tired of mobs in your base? Want to build somewhere.. Different? Probably in a void Dimension? Then this is your chance. But choose wisely; You can only pick one option

questDatabase.name: Final choice: Loot
questDatabase.description: Don't need a void dim, eh? Well, then you'll probably be happy about some extra loot. Choose wisely; You can only pick one

questDatabase.name: Almost unbreakable
questDatabase.description: Probably not required anymore, but you made so many walls, so why not make some Tier5?

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 5
questDatabase.description: Tough materials, for tough weapons. Railguns, and lasers, and.. stuff. I assume you want a lot of those soon

questDatabase.name: Turret base Tier 5
questDatabase.description: The last one, I promise. Used for the most powerful turrets available. You wonder if they might help you take out some more... "Dangerous" enemies..?

questDatabase.name: PewPew!
questDatabase.description: Requires no ammo, but still does a ton of damage. All you need to do is feed it power

questDatabase.name: Railguns, what else
questDatabase.description: Massive power, and a wonderful sound when they fire. I recommend to use upgrades to increase range and damage

questLines.name: Tier 0 - It begins
questLines.description: The very first Tier, Tier zero. This chapter will introduce the basic mechanics of this modpack. Mods covered: Vanilla, Pam's Harvestcraft

questLines.name: Tier 0.5 - Stone Age
questLines.description: Basically the "Tier 0" of all your progression. This set helps you through the first tier until you can build your first voltage-based machine

questLines.name: Tier 2 - 32 EU (LV)
questLines.description: The first "Voltage" Tier of this pack. Things are getting easier...

questLines.name: Tier 3 - 128 EU (MV)
questLines.description: Your second voltage tier. Don't ever mix 2 different voltage levels, or you will be punished in a hard way

questLines.name: Tier 4 - 512 EU (HV)
questLines.description: Finally some power to work with. This tier will help you prepare to reach distant planets and gather more rare resources to build even more advanced machines

questLines.name: Tier 6 and beyond
questLines.description: The last regular tier that will "guide" you

questLines.name: Multiblock Goals
questLines.description: This set is a global tracker for multiblock goals structures. As you can build several parts of many multiblocks way earlier than the respecive tier
